news.title: Figma Integrates Claude Code for Seamless Prototype Transfers
news.summary: Build better products as a team. Design, prototype, and gather feedback all in one place. View all Figma updates. Latest Tool News.
news.content: Figma has announced a significant enhancement that allows users to push their prototypes built in Claude Code directly to the Figma canvas. This new capability will help designers explore multiple design directions without having to create branches from their code or starting from scratch. Key Features of the Update: Integration with Claude Code : Users can now directly import working prototypes from Claude Code into Figma. Seamless Workflow : This integration enables designers to place prototypes alongside other design elements for better comparison and iteration. Easy Start : To begin using this feature, simply install the plugin with the command: /plugin install figma@claude-plugin-directory . Documentation Available : For detailed instructions on connecting Claude Code to the remote Figma MCP servers, refer to the documentation here . news.content: Company Guides Canva is one of the most remarkable technology success stories to come out of Australia — and increasingly, one of the most sought-after employers in the global tech industry. With a valuation exceeding $40 billion, over 170 million monthly active users across 190 countries, and a mission to democratize design, Canva has built a product that competes with Adobe while remaining accessible to anyone with a browser. Landing a role at Canva means joining a company that operates at enormous scale while maintaining the intensity and ambition of a startup. This guide covers everything you need to know to prepare for and succeed in Canva’s interview process. What Makes Canva Different Understanding Canva’s identity is essential to succeeding in its interviews. Canva is not simply a tech company that happens to make design tools — design thinking is embedded in every layer of the organization, including how it hires. Design-first engineering culture. news.content: It's a familiar story, isn't it? You sign up for a free trial, excited about all the premium features, and then... life happens. Before you know it, that trial period is about to end, and the thought of navigating subscription cancellations can feel a bit daunting. Some platforms make it feel like a labyrinth, leaving you worried about unexpected charges. If you've been enjoying Canva Pro but are ready to step back before the billing kicks in, let's walk through how to make that transition as smooth as possible. Understanding the Lay of the Land: Before You Hit 'Cancel' Before we dive into the 'how-to,' it's good to have a couple of things clear. Canva's approach to refunds is generally tied to how you initially subscribed. If you signed up directly on their website, refunds aren't automatic after a renewal, but you can always reach out to their support team to discuss your situation. news.summary: Integrated across Adobe Creative Cloud, it allows designers to generate images, vectors, textures and colour variations from text prompts in multiple languages.
news.content: Insight Feb 24, 2026 Amplifying creativity with AI tools for designers in 2026 Written by Ashlea Spitz RGD, Pixsoul Media Inc. AI has moved well beyond novelty in the design field, and, in 2026, many designers are actively exploring how it might support parts of their creative practice. Rather than replacing creative thinking, today’s AI tools are increasingly being tested as ways to assist with ideation, refinement, production and evaluation, when used thoughtfully and responsibly. From AI-assisted moodboarding to image editing guided by sketches and UX analysis tools that surface potential friction points, the current generation of platforms is designed to integrate into existing workflows rather than override them. This article does not aim to recommend or endorse specific tools. Instead, it highlights examples of AI-enabled platforms designers may encounter or choose to explore, depending on their individual practice, context and ethical considerations. As with any technology, AI i

news.title: Figma vs. Sketch vs. Adobe XD: Which Design Tool Is Right for You?
news.summary: Adobe XD, like Sketch, is a desktop application that syncs with Adobe's Creative Cloud. 2. Collaboration. These platform differences directly impact how ...
news.content: Figma vs. Sketch vs. Adobe XD: Which Design Tool Is Right for You? Written by Coursera Staff • Updated on Feb 21, 2026 Learn about the key differences between these popular design tools and how to figure out the best one for you. Key takeaways Sketch and Adobe XD have long been among the more popular design tools, but in recent years, Figma has emerged as a competitive alternative. Figma is available as a cloud-based app and desktop app for Windows and Mac; Sketch is exclusive to macOS; and Adobe XD offers a desktop application. Figma is most flexible for vector manipulation, using vector networks that connect multiple lines to a single point, while paths in Sketch and Adobe XD restrict you to a sequence of connected points (called nodes). You can decide which design tool is best for you by considering whether you need real-time collaboration or if you primarily work independently. news.summary: You've likely heard about Adobe's Creative Cloud, a powerhouse for designers, photographers, and video editors. But when the term '3D' or 'Chroma' pops up in ...
news.content: It's easy to get lost in the labyrinth of software subscriptions, isn't it? Especially when you're trying to figure out the cost of specific tools for your creative projects. You've likely heard about Adobe's Creative Cloud, a powerhouse for designers, photographers, and video editors. But when the term '3D' or 'Chroma' pops up in pricing discussions, it can feel like a whole new layer of complexity. Let's cut through the noise. When people ask about '3D' pricing in the context of Adobe, they're almost certainly referring to the Adobe Substance 3D Collection . This isn't just a single app; it's a suite designed for professionals who are deep into 3D modeling, texturing, and rendering. Think of it as the go-to for creating realistic materials, environments, and assets for games, film, or product visualization. The Substance 3D Collection itself is priced at €59.38 per month (inclusive of VAT), and this grants you access to a range of tools for modeling, texturing, and rendering, along w

news.title: Affinity Designer: A Deep Dive Into Its Strengths and Weaknesses for ...
news.summary: Affinity Designer offers a powerful, subscription-free vector graphics experience with a focus on performance and an intuitive interface.
news.content: When you're deep in the creative trenches, the tools you use can feel like extensions of your own mind. For graphic designers, especially those working with vector graphics, the software landscape is often dominated by a few big names. But what if there's a powerful, more accessible option that doesn't demand a monthly subscription? That's where Affinity Designer often enters the conversation. At its heart, Affinity Designer is built to be a workhorse. The developers talk about a "stripped back, pro-end" approach, meaning you get the essential tools without a lot of unnecessary fluff. It's designed to feel responsive and fluid, keeping pace with modern hardware. This focus on performance is a big draw, especially when you're dealing with complex designs or need to zoom in to a million percent without losing precision – yes, you read that right. One of the most frequently praised aspects is its user interface. Many users find it intuitive and a breath of fresh air compared to other indu

Adobe vs Affinity is not just a debate about design software features, price or brand loyalty. For production-driven teams, the choice affects workflow efficiency, collaboration, and long-term scalability. Both platforms have earned credibility as professional design software that meets industry expectations and client handoff standards. On the surface, they appear comparable. In practice, however, the differences become clear when projects scale, deadlines tighten, and workflows grow more complex. sponsored message This article compares Adobe and Affinity through a practical, workflow-focused lens .
